poem:
**Lessons in Absence**

The desks remember,
erased names,
silent corridors echo
sentences of exclusion.

Suspensions suspended 
hope in mid-air, 
leaving dreams to gather dust
in the corners of disadvantage.

The pandemic closed doors,
and some never unlocked,
as if education itself 
had caught the cough.
